headline: Addictive Sweet Potato Burritos
description: These unusual burritos are made with sweet potatoes, spices and kidney beans. They freeze well and can be deep-fried instead of baked.

video.description: These vegetarian burritos have a slightly spicy and utterly addictive flavor.
video.name: Addictive Sweet Potato Burritos

name: Addictive Sweet Potato Burritos
recipeIngredient: 1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Heat oil in a medium skillet and saute onion and garlic until soft. Mash beans into the onion mixture. Gradually stir in water; heat until warm, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the soy sauce, chili powder, mustard, cumin, and cayenne pepper.
Divide bean mixture and mashed sweet potatoes evenly between the tortillas; top with cheese. Fold tortillas burrito-style around the fillings and place on a baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until warmed through, about 12 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I enjoyed this unique burrito and my 3 and 6 year olds ate one as well. I used 1 teaspoon of chili powder and 1 teaspoon of cumin (because of my young kids) and only 1 cup of water. I can't imagine adding 2 - it would be like a soup. At tip - if you wait until the bean mixture has thoroughly cooled, it's much less watery and easier to fill into the tortillas. We ate some and froze the rest.
Kind of bland. And two cups of water??? It's like trying to roll soup into a burrito. By the time I am able to doctor it up enough to make it good I might as well use a different recipe all together.
Made it with ground turkey. It added texture.
We have been making this recipe for years and the whole family loves it. We sometimes use black beans or a mix of black and kidney beans. Great for school lunches if there are any leftovers!

I followed the recipe and 2 adults and 1 teen loved it, and asked for it again. I used 4 sweet potatoes and a one pound bag of dried kidney beans, prepared ahead of time. I might try a different bean next time.
It was heavenly! Instead of a our cream I took plain greek yogurt and added taco sauce to it to make a dip. I'm addicted!!

First of all, this makes a LOT. I’ll probably half it in the future. That being said, I used black beans and 3 cans was 5 cups. Rather than open another can, I just used 5 and added the seasonings by adding the last part of the measurement gradually - for example, if it called for 3 teaspoons, I added two teaspoons and added the third one by taste. I was surprised at how spicy the beans were. I like spice, but didn’t add the pinch of cayenne. The great thing about this recipe, in my opinion, is that, although the beans are spicy, the sweetness of the potatoes balance that out. I put the cheese inside the burrito instead of on top of them. I like sour cream or guacamole on burritos, but these were great as is, as well. They are filling, too. This is a very nice and inexpensive vegetarian recipe! I will be making it again!
These were delicious & so glad I tried them! The only beans I had were garbanzos but tasted great!

My wife and I enjoy this recipe. They freeze well and make quick meals from the freezer. I followed the recipe as written the firist 2-3 times but wanted to experiment. 

I added bell pepper and celery and a lbs or lean ground meat (well of course, this way it's no longer vegetarian) I also mixed all ingredients except cheese before putting on tortillas. It made about 18.

Good and easy. I did what other reviewers suggested and used black beans and did not mash the beans. I used very little to no water since I did not mash the beans. I will be doing again. NOTE: Can make components ahead of time, store in refrigerator and make burritos as needed throughout the week.
Very good, not hard to make.
I felt this was very good! I didn't have enough kidney beans, so I had to use a can of black beans. I would definitely make this again.

These are my new favorite burritos, they are so delicious. I made only a couple of minor changes: I used black beans instead of kidney beans after reading some of the other reviews. I also used the canned yams instead of sweet potatoes because I was unable to find fresh sweet potatoes in any store near me. The combination of the spices in the beans and the flavor and sweetness of the yams is fabulous. Because I love very spicy food and my family not so much, I added chopped jalapenos to only half of the burritos, so everyone was happy! This recipe is definitely a keeper.

WOW! The hype it legit! I halved the recipe and wish I hadn’t! Used 2 cans of black beans and about 3/4 cup chicken broth (instead of water) and probably could have used less (maybe 1/2 cup for the half recipe). Also used vegan pepper jack “cheese” since one of us is dairy free.
Made mine with chicken like making fajitas. Very tasty even added red onions sautéed.!

It was a lot of fun to create. It was very simple and straight forward. To be honest, we weren't sure how it would turn out, but we were very PLEASANTLY surprised!

After making this dish once, it has now become our go-to dish for dinner parties, get-togethers, or anything that requires us to bring a dish. We even found that adding cilantro gives the dish the perfect and finishing touches.

I was intrigued with the ingredients of this burrito but no one in my family liked them. One thing I may have done wrong was to put too much of the sweet potato in each one. I think if I'd used less SP and more of the bean mixture it might have been better received.
Used black beans, made for 4 but 2 cups of sweet potatoes, made 7

My daughter is vegetarian and this is one of the family's favourite recipes. I have used both kidney and black beans. Either are good. I do like to use chipolte chili spice. It adds a nice smokey flavour. These burritos freeze easily and my kids can pull one out for a quick lunch. They are really filling.

The mixture itself is bland. It needed more seasoning, for sure. I made a fresh white corn and avocado mixture with cotija cheese to put on top and added a dollop of greek yogurt (rather than sour cream) and it was good. It's a great base with which to get more creative with flavors.

These burritos are so good I eat all the leftovers myself! I do freeze half for a bit later. The water is way too much. I make half the recipe, which calls for one cup of water. I use about 1/5 of a cup and it comes out perfect!
No need to smash kidney beans. Using refried beans next time.
I rarely make the same recipe twice and this one is on the list! I love the flavors of the kidney bean mixture with the sweet potatoes and cheese! It's an awesome mix!

As written, this recipe makes a lot! You may want to halve it. Second tip: measure the sweet potatoes *after* mashing. The second time I made this recipe, I ended up mashing sweet potato tater tots because my husband bought the wrong bag of frozen potatoes. I think they tasted better with the mashed tots!

I used pinto and kidney beans otherwise I followed the recipe. I made lime rice with cilantro and tried it in a burrito it was another level of flavor. I will definitely make this one again and maybe add some shredded chicken to it .
Super tasty!! Not a fan of onions so I cut the onions down to 1/4 of an onion, and it was great!! Made so many burritos (used smaller tortillas) I had half the filling left! Highly recommend.
I loved this recipe! It tasted just like normal burritos, and it was pretty easy to make. I will definitely be making this again!

The house gives this a 4.5 out of 5
I used refried beef Instead of beans

I loved these burritos! I ate one, refrigerated 4, and froze 4 for later. Ended up only making 9 because I made them bean heavy for a lack of sweet potatoes. The water was a bit much. I only used 1 cup to help mash up the kidney beans. I definitely should have ready more reviews to get some tips first, but I really loved them!

We really enjoyed these! Used the black beans since they're smaller and different color. Only used half the amount of water listed. Reduced the overall recipe because it would have yielded too much for our family of four. Garnished with sour cream at the end.

Worst thing I've made in quite a while. I made the recipe, just to see what the serious hype was about. I failed to realize that all the reviewers must not have had taste buds. 

Skip this meal. A Lunchable beats this hands down!
Great tasting, but I wouldn't add so much water. Makes the mixture too liquid.
The whole family enjoyed. Left it a little chunky for our preference.

My family gave it mixed reviews. More of a 2.5 on average. Lowest of 1 and 2 five star ratings. The 1 rating is my daughter who is a super taster...with very ‘selective’ preferences. So, I was excited to read reviews where the kids enjoyed this meal, but alas, the selective tastebuds strike again!
I will make these again. The were delicious!

I made these for a vegetarian friend and she loves them! Since she is convalescing, I packaged them individually into freezer ziplock bags. When she wants one, She takes the burrito out of the plastic, wets a paper towel, wraps the burrito in it and microwaves it for 1-2 min. My husband and I are omnivores and we, of course, loved them too. I made them just as the recipe suggested. TWICE so far. Delicious Fresh or reheated in the microwave.

I was expecting more. I made them for the first time for company and was a little disappointed. They were bland, not much flavor or pizazz. I guess I could have added more of the seasoning but I probably just won't make them again.

These were delicious! As I saw on the reviews, I also used black beans. I only needed about 3/4 cup of water, not the 2 cups listed in the recipe. We also reduced the cheese a bit as well, but also found they are delicious without cheese. Great recipe!
Interesting mix of flavors. Liked them a lot!

I've made this recipe several times. As writtten I give it 4 stars. I prefer using black beans in place of the kidney beans. And I don't completely mash them. I like some chunks left for some texture. I also like to use a flat out (or healthier tortilla wrap) than what was suggested. This is definitely a go to, easy recipe I have made in heavy rotation. Thank you for the recipe.

These also turn out great in the air fryer!

Thanks Karena,awesome! I have made these twice now, and my vegetarian daughter and I love these !This recipe makes a lot, so I’m freezing some , which is a plus !I followed the recipe, other than 2 cups kidney beans, 2 cups black beans, and a cup of rice .I love these !
I left out the water after reading the reviews, but did everything else by the recipe and they were wonderful! Will be making these again.

Delicious! After reading reviews, I substituted the kidney beans for black beans. Other than that, I followed the recipe and fully enjoyed the results! It sounded like a weird combo, but I ended up enjoying it immensely
Great recipe. I used to much sweet potato for the first few, but got it down by then end. Will make again!

I made an easier version of this recipe for 4 people. After sauteing the onion and garlic I added about 1/3 cup of water and mixed in peeled, cubed sweet potatoes along with chickpeas (which are easier to digest). I used more potato than peas. While it was cooking I graded cheese. When it was done, about 20 min later, I added 1/3rd of the rest of the ingredients and mashed it all in the same pan. We spooned the mixture into tortillas. Served it with the cheese, sour cream and salsa. Excellent vegetarian meal and the cumin gives it a wonderful flavor. Thank you for sharing.
nice alternative to meat burritos. next time I would reduce the amount of water to 1 1/2 cups but just added another can of beans to save this batch.

Everyone loved it. It was proclaimed the best meatless I meal that I ever made! I couldn't find kidney beans and sout cream, so I used white northern means and plain greek yogurt. My family wolfed them down, and we happily ate the leftovers for a couple of days0.

Getting into vegetarian cooking has been difficult, but these burritos are easy-pasy. Plus they taste great! We normally make these for our meal prep once a month or so. They cook up quick which is also a huge bonus. I always eyeball the seasoning and just do it to taste.

Oh dear Lord, these are good. I made the recipe exactly (except I only used about 1/4 c. water) and these were truly a religious experience. I've been putting off making these because I really thought the sweet potatoes would be too sweet and weird. They're not! Also, you may think adding mustard and soy sauce are the oddest thing ever, but these ingredients totally work and make the filling irresistible. The only negative thing I can say about this recipe is there is a very real danger of eating half of the filling out of the bowl while preparing the burritos. It takes A LOT of restraint. And need I state how healthy these are? I think I just did : ) I ate these with guacamole (although it isn't really needed.) Yummmmmmmmmy.
This was a weird bunch of ingredients but tasted great.
Delicious!

These are excellent. I used black beans and much less cheese than the recipe calls for. Also, I sauteed the spices with the onions and only added enough water to make the bean mixture spreadable. Yummy.
I make this almost every week. But to make it more easy, I take a can of pinto beans, grind them up in the blender, and then mix into the sweet burritos. Or just use a can of refined beans.
I've made this dozens of times. One of my favourite vegetarian recipes. Kids love it too. We often swap black beans for kidney beans or do a half and half split. Otherwise we make it as listed.

Delicious! I did have to use black beans because it's all I had, but I kept everything else the same and these were amazing. Even my kids, who do not like sweet potatoes, loved these and ate up all the leftovers the next day. Thank you so much for this recipe! A keeper!
It was great for a vegetarian dish but for a regular dish it was just OK. I would definitely serve it with salsa, shredded lettuce and sour cream.
Added mushrooms to the onions. Added only enough water to the onion and bean mixture to moisten it. Used an Adobo pepper in Sauce but could have been spicier. Forgot the onion....too bad.
I did the recipe as written and my friends loved it and asked where I got the recipe from. One friend is interested in giving it to her vegan family.
I didn't have soy sauce, so I used Worcestershire - very yummy!

I’ve made this recipe a few times, and it’s always a crowd pleaser! The only reason I gave this four stars instead of five is because I now leave the soy sauce and mustard out. It was still delicious, just a personal preference. I’ve also made it with black beans, kidney beans, and mashed lentils. The options for this recipe are unlimited and always turn out great!
Excellent. I will make this again
really quite good and different.. my husband ate 3 and didn't even know it wasn't just beans and cheese LOL
FANTASTIC! Nice twist instead of a 'mexican' burrito - delicious and yes...addicting!

These have been a hit since the first time I made them. My Ex Husband loves them, My current boyfriend loves them, I send these out to friends and family as gifts for special occasions.. they're always always amazing! I follow the recipe to a T and it is one of my absolute favorites.

I deceased the recipe to 4 from 12 burritos and used canned black beans and roasted fresh sweet potato. I served with sour cream, guacamole, chopped lettuce and tomato on the side and sprinkled shredded cheese and bottled tomatillo salsa on top. It was really good! My meat loving Latin husband really liked them too!
I followed the recipe as is and found them just ok. Next time I’ll add more cheese, chicken and not bother with sweet potato. Good basic recipe that I can use again with alterations. Thanks.
The title is right - these are addictive. Also very “make ahead” friendly, they crisp right up after thawing and baking again at 425 for 12 minutes.
These were surprisingly delicious. I made them to accommodate vegetarian family and they were great!

This is a good recipe! I'll diffidently make it again. Next time, I will chunk the sweet potatoes instead of mashing them, saute some pepper slices (to add color and crunch), and I might even add some steak strips.
These were really good. I used black beans and shredded Mexican cheese blend. And since we are all carnivores ;) I added pulled pork bbq to ours. Will definitely make again!!

I was skeptical of this recipe, thinking it would be bland, and was so pleasantly surprised at how it turned out! Only did a few things different than the original recipe: 2 tablespoons of chili powder instead of three, cooked the onion first, released the flavor of the garlic by cooking it for a minute with the onion, then added all the spices to the onion garlic mixture to release the flavor of the spices. I added all remaining ingredients to the warm pan to mix, but omitted the water as I didn’t want the same mashed consistency of the potatoes for the beans. I only roughly mashed the beans once added so there was more texture. We froze the remaining burritos for lunches/snacks as needed so we’ll see how that turns out too!! Will definitely be making these again. I’ll probably add green pepper next time too
Fantastic! I used less water and only two cans of beans...delish.

I discovered this recipe years ago and have been making these ever since! My only variation (which is tastier and easier in my opinion) is this: I use refried black beans instead of the whole kidney beans. More flavorful, better texture, and much easier than mashing whole beans. Just use about 1/2 cup to whole cup less than the recipe calls for and less water. I also find that Colby Jack cheese is a nice replacement for cheddar, as it melts so nicely and pairs well with the other flavors. Less oily, too. Sour cream on top is definitely delish!
Delicious!

I've made a lot of delicious recipes from here with 1K+ 5-star ratings and have been very pleased, but this one disappointed me. This recipe was very bland and I will not make again. The title "Addictive" is a total exaggeration. No rehab needed. One hit and I quit cold turkey.
They are addictive! I didn’t have an oven so I microwaved them for 5 mins in a microwave bag. Turned out fine.
Delicious!
Great vegetarian option for the kids.
Very Yummy! I added ground turkey for some protein! I also used Gluten Free wraps!

We love these and make them regularly! I follow what other reviewers have said and use less beans and split half kidney and half black beans. I like putting extra cheese on top and inside because I love cheese :-) We also wrap them up and freeze them for easy lunches and dinners later!
Excellent!

Very good recipe, the texture was a bit too mushy in my opinion (I don’t like the taste of baby food in my mouth) LOL! Was a great leftover meal I have to say, will DEF be making this again. Stay groovy fellow recipe reviewers!
Easy and healthy. I "mashed" the beans and sweet potatoes in a food processor, which made it even easier. Can use either the bean mixture or sweet potatoes as sides.
This has become one of my favorite recipes. I usually use 2-3 types of beans instead of all kidney beans. I don't mash the black beans if I use them.

I took the advice of some of the people that made this after reading quite a few reviews. I used 1 can of kidney beans & 1 can of black beans as this is what I had in my pantry. I did not add any water to the beans. This would have made it too soupy. One reviewer added chopped cilantro to the bean mixture and I did this also. Good idea. I was surprised at how well the mustard & soy sauce enhanced the flavors. I will make this again.

We all loved this recipe! I made the fillings (used 1/2 red and 1/2 black beans and only one cup of water) the day before because I had to go out on the day we were having them. When I got home, I assembled the burritos quickly, baked them, and served them with salsa, sour cream, guacamole, and chopped lettuce and tomato. Accompanied them with Vegan Paella from this site. A different, fun, great meal.

YUM! These were simple to make and so tasty. I did add the spices to the onion and garlic as I think cooking them a little brings out the flavour. I substituted a tin of refried beans for the kidney beans, so only added half the water, and used Tex-Mex cheese blend. 
#Allrecipesallstarscanada
#TACOLOVE
Made exactly as written. We loved it. Definitely will make again.
Not much to say. I liked it but my GF didn't so it looks like I won't be making this again!

These are really good! The recipe makes a lot of burritos, I think I made 10 in total with smaller tortillas. With sour cream and salsa on top, we all enjoyed these, very much. Will definitely make these again!

I too left out the cayenne, as I have small kids at home. I found the filling a bit runny, probably because I used canned kidney beans, so if you are using canned kidney beans too you may want to cut back on the water. Otherwise these were perfect! The bean filling is so flavorful, really it is all you need the sweet potatoes are an added bonus! Great, will definitely make again!
Refried beans can be used in lieu of red kidney beans, if so no water is needed.
Its better then most Vegan food.

These are great!

I used low-sodium soy sauce, 1 can each of low-sodium black beans, chickpeas, and kidney beans, and whole wheat tortillas. I only had honey mustard, and that added an interesting dimension to the flavor!

Will definitely make this again - both my husband and I loved it!
A new favorite at our house. Added some avocado at my husband's request. Reduced beans to 1 cup and doubled the sweet potatoes. Turned out wonderful.

When I saw this and wondered if these flavours could be good together. I decided to go for it omitting the mustard and soy sauce which sounded terrible to me and am sorry to say no they don't . Sweet potatoes and chili beans are not a good combination. 3 out of 5 of us ate it anyways because we don't waste food here. I think this recipe must have come about as a creative attempt to use what was left in the fridge so I gave an extra star for that it is creative. You could do this with russet potatoes and it would be good. Also you do not need to drain your beans and add water. I used two cans kidney and two cans chili flavoured red beans.
Just okay. Too much sweet potato and the flavor combo for the beans didn't work for me. I had to cover them in chimichurri sauce to make them taste better.
So excited! My daughter is a vegetarian and generally cooks for herself. I was so excited to make these for her! She loved, loved love them... and they were super easy to make.

After adding water we cooked a little longer until it started to cook off . Served cayenne pepper on the side so my 2 year old could eat it too and everything was delicious!! Kids were going for second servings.
